activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brendan William Mades III

records.addlTxt: 10:00 AM Defendant Brendan William Mades III appeared by video.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by video for Brendan William Mades III.  Attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik in court for State of Wisconsin. Matter to be set. Following 21CF683.
Justice Point: Rock County Supervision Report
Adjourned initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:10 PM Defendant Brendan William Mades III appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by video for Brendan William Mades III.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report

No contact directly or indirectly with victim, his/her residence T.G, , place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety. Curfew in must be in residence from  6 pm and 6 am unless working or going to and from work.   Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.

3:51 PM Defendant Brendan William Mades III appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anna Elizabeth Hartz appeared by video for Brendan William Mades III.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant address and date of birth verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court, jury trial to be set.
